citation.text: 7 The affidavit evidence discloses that there are intricate factual and legal matters, involving numerous parties, arising in the Supreme Court proceedings. This Court may grant leave under s 58(3) of the Bankruptcy Act if it considers that the issues would be better and more comprehensively dealt with by a contested trial of the action in the Supreme Court than would be the case if the applicants were required to lodge a proof of debt in respect of the bankrupt estate: see Allanson v Midland Credit Limited and Anor (1977) 30 FLR 108 at 114 per Bowen CJ, Riley and Deane JJ; Macquarie Bank Ltd v Bardetta and Ors (2005) 216 ALR 670 at [19]-[21] per Conti J.

9 For these reasons, the Court considers that leave should be granted. The applicants seek that leave be granted effective from 26 July 2005. This Court has power to make a nunc pro tunc order: see Re Veghelyi; Smith and Ors v Official Trustee in Bankruptcy (1993) 45 FCR 413. Accordingly, the Court will make the orders as sought.
